sequential_cigna_first.name: Sequential (Cigna First)
sequential_cigna_first.description: Submit to Cigna (primary payer) first, wait for determination, then proceed to UHC if approved. Standard approach following primary/secondary coverage order.
sequential_cigna_first.rationale: Traditional approach following insurance coordination rules. Submit to primary payer first, obtain determination, then coordinate with secondary. Lower complexity but longer timeline.
risk_factors: Extended timeline if primary payer denies or requests additional information
Secondary payer submission delayed until primary determination
mitigation_strategies: Prepare comprehensive documentation upfront to minimize information requests
Have appeal materials ready in case of denial
Maintain regular follow-up schedule with primary payer
Set clear timeline expectations with patient

steps.description: Submit prior authorization to Cigna with complete documentation
Monitor Cigna PA status, respond to any information requests
Upon Cigna approval, submit to UHC with COB documentation
Monitor UHC PA status, coordinate benefits

best_for: When primary payer has clear approval pathway

parallel.name: Parallel Submission
parallel.description: Submit prior authorization requests to both Cigna and UHC simultaneously. Fastest approach to obtain coverage.
parallel.rationale: Maximize speed by pursuing both payers simultaneously. Reduces overall timeline but increases coordination complexity. Best when time to treatment is critical.
risk_factors: Coordination complexity between two active PA requests
May need to reconcile different approval terms
mitigation_strategies: Use identical documentation packages for both submissions
Track both submissions carefully with clear status updates
Have team resources dedicated to parallel tracking

steps.description: Submit prior authorization to UHC simultaneously
Monitor both submissions, respond to requests from either payer
Upon approvals, coordinate benefits between payers

best_for: When both payers have similar requirements
Organizations with resources for parallel tracking

optimized_uhc_first.name: Optimized (UHC First)
optimized_uhc_first.description: Start with UHC despite being secondary payer, due to higher likelihood of rapid approval based on policy analysis. Then coordinate with Cigna.
optimized_uhc_first.rationale: Policy analysis indicates UHC has clearer approval criteria for this case and faster processing times. By securing UHC approval first, we establish medical necessity documentation that strengthens the Cigna submission.
risk_factors: Non-standard approach may require explanation to billing
Some providers unfamiliar with secondary-first approach
May need to justify approach if questioned
mitigation_strategies: Document rationale for approach in case notes
Coordinate with billing team on COB implications
Prepare explanation for any payer questions about sequence
Use UHC approval as supporting evidence for Cigna

steps.description: Submit prior authorization to UHC first (higher approval likelihood)
Monitor UHC PA status, expect faster determination
Submit to Cigna with UHC approval as supporting documentation
Monitor Cigna PA with UHC precedent established

best_for: Cases where secondary payer has clearer pathway
When policy analysis shows approval likelihood differential
Experienced PA teams comfortable with non-standard approaches
